```{r setup, include=FALSE}
rm(list = ls())
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE)
library(here)
library(tidyverse)
```

This notebook just replicates some of the example of [cars](https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/datasets/html/cars.html) from `datasets` by using `tidyverse`.

The data is set by the following code.
```r
write_csv(as.tibble(cars), file = here("data/cars.csv"))
```

## Analysis
### Plot
```{r}
cars %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = speed, y = dist)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(span = 2/3) +
  labs(title = "cars data", x = "Speed (mph)", y = "Stopping distance (ft)") +
  theme_minimal()
```

### Regression
```{r}
summary(fm1 <- lm(log(dist) ~ log(speed), data = cars))
```
